name: FINAL EXAM Part I (Writing)
intro:
Write a short paragraph of at least 10 sentences to describe the place where you live. What do you like or dislike about it?
Use specific details and adjectives to explain your answers. 
Make sure to organize the paragraph with  a topic sentence and supporting detail sentences.
Use prepositional phrases to describe locations, there is / there are, articles and proper grammar and punctuation.

name: Descriptive Short Essay Practice.
intro:
Now is your chance to practice writing your first short essay before your exam on Monday the 7th.  I want you to write a 3 paragraph essay that....

1.  Describe your favorite food; Think of these questions to help you write.  What is it?  Where do you eat it?  Who do you eat it with?  What does it taste, look, sound, smell and feel like?  Do you cook it, or buy it somewhere? What do you hear when you cook it or eat it?  Why is it your favorite?

OR


2.  Describe your favorite place to visit.  Where is it?  Why is it important to you?  Who do you go there with?  What do you see, hear, feel, smell and taste when you are there?  

Each essay should have an introductory paragraph with a hook, background information, and a strong thesis statement with your main idea for the whole essay.  It should have one body paragraph with a topic sentence, and several specific details and descriptions to make your subject come alive to the reader.  And you should finish with a concluding paragraph that restates your main idea, gives your main points, and maybe your final thoughts about your subject.  

It is due in just a few days so I can give you feedback before your exam. You can submit a file, or you can type directly into Moodle. Do it, and do your best.  Remember the form, and the layout from page 3 in your writing book.  Indent the beginning of each paragraph.  Do not copy anything from the internet or other students.  You will need to be able to write a different and maybe longer one on Monday, so do your best.  You CAN DO IT!

name: Final EXAM: Part II (Writing)
intro:
Write a short paragraph of at least 10 sentences to describe the place where you live. What do you like or dislike about it?

Use specific details and adjectives to explain your answers. 

Make sure to organize the paragraph with  a topic sentence and supporting detail sentences.

Use prepositional phrases to describe locations, there is / there are, articles and proper grammar and punctuation.

សិស្សនឹងបានពិន្ទុទៅលើការវាយតម្លៃ ៥ ចំណុច​ដូចខាងក្រោម ៖

1.     It has  a topic sentence and supporting details (4 points)

2.       Students use prepositional phrases to describe locations (4 points)

3.    Students  use there is and there are appropriately with singular and plural nouns (4 points)  

4.     Each sentence begins with a capital letter and ends with a period. (4 points)  

5.     Students use the articles a, an, the correctly  (4points)

name: 4a: QUIZ – WRITING A PROCESS PARAGRAPH (for SCORES)
intro: WRITING  EXERCISE – You have 60 minutes to write

id:
\na Process paragraph.

Write a process paragraph about
\nsteps how to apply for a job
\nthe steps how to grow vegetables, fruit, or rice
\nthe steps for online learning English class
\nchoosing 1 topic, explain why, how, when, what, where etc.
\nthe topic sentence and supporting sentences. The paragraph ends
\nRevising. GOOD LUCK 😊 and write the best you can!

\n

Focus and relax while writing your process paragraph.

name: Brainstorming and Outline for the Descriptive Essay
intro:
You are going to write a descriptive essay about your favorite food. 

First, you must write out a brainstorming activity and an essay outline. Please follow the instructions below. 

On your own note book paper, write a brainstorming mind map and an essay outline.

Follow the same format as the two templates below. 

After you have written out both the brainstorming mind map and the essay outline, take photos of your hand written work and upload those photos here in Moodle.

This assignment is due by Friday January 15 by 11:59 p.m.

name: Final EXAM (Essay)
intro:
Now it is time to write your own compare and contrast essay.  You need to pick two places.  They can be any places that you want.  They can be places you love, or places you want to go to. They can be where you grew up, or where you would like to go to school.  ANY TWO Places.  Write an essay that tells of the similarities and differences between the two places.  You need to have a proper introductory paragraph, that introduces the places and gives some background information, and your thesis statement.  You need to have at least two body paragraphs where you explore the places in detail, and a proper concluding paragraph.  You must tell of specific details to support your comparisons, or contrasts. You must have at least one sentence that uses comparison-contrast connectors like we learned about.  You must have at least 3 comparative statements.  Be sure you proofread your essay before you submit it.  You will be graded harder on correct grammar this time.  You are all smart and have improved a lot this term.  Now it is time to show it!   

You can use grammar check software or apps, but no copying from the internet or other students.  ANY copied sentences found will mean you receive a 0, and fail the essay part.  

YOU CAN DO IT!

name: Midterm Part 2 The Short Essay
intro:
Ok students, now is the time to show what you have learned about writing short essays.  For this essay, you need to write about your favorite place.  It can be somewhere you took a holiday with your family, where you go to hang out with your friends, or a beautiful place you like to go by yourself.  It can be any of the Temples, your favorite beach, where you like to go fishing, somewhere in the countryside, or a city, or even your home. 

You need to have at least an introductory paragraph, with a hook, background information, and a thesis statement with your main idea.  There needs to be at least one body paragraph where you use specific language and describe the place, using adjectives, AT LEAST ONE SIMILE, and one prepositional phrase. And finally, there must be a concluding PARAGRAPH (not one sentence like some of you did in the practice essay).

To help you write, use the outline on page 50.  Close your eyes, and imagine the place.  Why is it special to you? What do you see, hear, smell, feel, taste?  Remember to be specific and descriptive.  You will be graded on content, form, organization and grammar.  You can do it!  Good luck.  I look forward to reading about your special place.

name: Midterm EXAM: Part 2 ( Writing)
intro: Write a descriptive paragraph about

id: \nchoosing 1 topic, the topic sentence introduces the item that you will describe.
\nIt may also include your general feeling or opinion about the item. Supporting
\nsentences give background information, they give also specific details (adjectives)
\nto describe the item (remember the 5 senses). The paragraph ends with a
\nconcluding sentence. Make sure, the reader can clearly ‘imagine’ or ‘see’ your
\nchosen item.
\nsteps: Brainstorming – Outlining – WRITING YOUR 1st DRAFT - Editing / Revising. GOOD LUCK
\nthe best you can! Focus and relax while writing your <u>descriptive paragraph</u>.        Write <u>at least</u> 75 words – <u>maximum</u>

name: MIDTERM EXAM (WRITING)
intro:
DIRECTIONS: You have 80 minutes to plan, write, and revise your paragraph. 

Typically, an effective response will contain a maximum of 150 words.


WRITING TASK:

Computers and other technologies allow people to do many different jobs. What is a job that requires technology? What does the worker do?


MAKE SURE:
  • Use verbs in the simple present third person singular
  • Use infinitives that express necessity

name: Mid-term Exam Part 2: Essay
intro: For this quiz, you will need to write your own short descriptive essay.  You can choose any topic you want.  If you can't think of one, you can write about one of the following topics.  What is your favorite memory from your childhood?  OR What is your favorite thing to do?  Please review the form of the short essay on pages 15-17 and look at the examples on pages 29, 34 and 37.  Use adjectives and similes to describe things: how they  taste, smell, look and feel.  Remember, the thesis statement, which has the controlling idea of the essay, comes at the end of the introductory paragraph.  You need an introductory paragraph, at least one body paragraph, and one concluding paragraph.  You will be graded on form, descriptions, and grammar.  Try to use adjectives to describe each noun, or adverbs to describe the verbs.  For this assignment, you need to type it into Moodle.  I cannot take pictures of your notebook, or work in telegram.  However you did it for the last quiz works fine.  Feel free to ask me questions in Zoom or on telegram, but I cannot give more feedback until I grade the essay.  PLEASE, EDIT YOUR OWN WORK BEFORE YOU SUBMIT IT.  GOOD LUCK.  YOU CAN DO THIS!

name: Write your own Narrative essay.
intro:
Now it is time to improve your essay form, and write your first story.  You need to think about some experience you had that taught you something.  It can be anything you want, or about whatever you want.  It can be true, or you can make it up.  But it MUST be your writing.  We will discuss more in class, but I want you to write about a time, or experience where you learned something.  And like the examples in the book,  A Scary Secret, and An Embarrassing Incident, it should be 4 paragraphs.  One Introductory paragraph, with a hook, some background information, and your thesis statement, or main idea of the story.  There should be two body paragraphs, and a concluding paragraph. 

I want you to remember to try and describe things, and get specific with your details, and supporting sentences.  Remember to try and use adverbs of time to show the sequence of events, and show your best grammar.  Feel free to message me in telegram if you have any questions, or if you want feedback on your essay before you submit it.  Try to use the outline on page 76 to help to you form your essay.  Good luck!  You can do it!

name: EXAM II (ESSAY)
intro:
Write  a 5-paragraph essay  to show the similarities and differences of an online class and  a face-to-face class . Which is better? How? Why?

Be well organized following the standard 5-paragraph essay format detailed below.

The introduction provides a hook, background information introducing the points of comparison and contains a strong thesis statement. Body paragraphs of 8 sentences include 3 supporting ideas with details or examples. Use proper grammar, spelling, and punctuation.

Write your own words.

Do not copy from the internet. Do not copy work from another student.

You may use a word processing program to help write your essay then paste text in the box below.

Follow the writing format given in class.

name: EXAM II (ESSAY)
intro:
Write  a 5-paragraph essay  to show the similarities and differences of an online class and  a face-to-face class . Which is better? How? Why?

Be well organized following the standard 5-paragraph essay format detailed below.

The introduction provides a hook, background information introducing the points of comparison and contains a strong thesis statement. Body paragraphs of 8 sentences include 3 supporting ideas with details or examples. Use proper grammar, spelling, and punctuation.

Write your own words.

Do not copy from the internet. Do not copy work from another student.

You may use a word processing program to help write your essay then paste text in the box below.

Follow the writing format given in class.

name: Write your own descriptive essay about your favorite food.
intro:
Ok, students.  Now it is time to try to write your own descriptive essay.  Use the brainstorming exercises from page 32 and 33 to get ideas and descriptive vocabulary, and write a short essay about your favorite food.  It can be from a restaurant, your families' cooking, or something you like to make.  Try to use adjectives to describe the food, the way it smells, looks, tastes and feels when you eat it. Think about where you are, who you are with when you cook, or eat it.  Try to be as descriptive as possible.  

You should follow the form we have been talking about, with an introductory paragraph (with a hook, background information and a thesis statement).  Then there should be at least 1 body paragraph, and a concluding paragraph. Use the information from page 33 as a guide. Remember to pay attention to grammar, especially run on sentences, subject/ verb agreement, sentence structure, and the correct parts of speech. 

Good luck.  I know you can do it!

name: IEAP 3 Unit 2 Quiz
intro: For this quiz, you will need to write your own short essay about your favorite food.  DO NOT WRITE A RECIPE, OR HOW TO MAKE IT.  Please review the form of the short essay on pages 15-17 and look at the examples on pages 29, 34 and 37.  Use adjectives and similes to describe how it tastes, smells, looks and feels.  Remember, the thesis statement, which has the controlling idea of the essay, comes at the end of the introductory paragraph.  You need an introductory paragraph, at least one body paragraph, and one concluding paragraph.  You will be graded on form, descriptions, and grammar.  Try to use adjectives to describe each noun, or adverbs to describe the verbs.  For this assignment, you need to type it into Moodle.  I cannot take pictures of your notebook, or work in telegram.  However you did it for the last quiz works fine.  Feel free to ask me questions in Zoom or on telegram, but I cannot give more feedback until I grade the essay.  PLEASE, EDIT YOUR OWN WORK BEFORE YOU SUBMIT IT.  GOOD LUCK.  YOU CAN DO THIS!

name: Your Moodles are Coming Right Up
intro:
Welcome to Paññasastra University of Cambodia
Siem Reap Campus

Intensive English for Academic Purposes
Writing Level 4 - The Researched Essay

name: IEAP 3 Unit 3 Quiz
intro: Write a narrative essay that tells a story about a time when you learned an important lesson.  Don't write about a test you took.  Write about something that happened to you in your life.  The purpose of the essay, and your story should be about what happened, and how you learned from it. Who was there, what happened?  Why?  When was it? Please be specific, descriptive when possible, and follow the form we have been learning.  Use the past continuous and simple past when appropriate. Be careful of run on sentences. Have at LEAST an introductory paragraph, a body paragraph, and a concluding paragraph.  I have assigned writing an outline, which I suggest you do.  Follow the outline form on page 76, or on the file that I put in the shared file folder.  I will give you feedback on your outline if you do one, but not on your essay until I grade it.  The most important thing is you show that you are improving your grammar, know the form of an effective essay and your story is well told.  Good luck.

name: FINAL EXAM (WRITING)
intro: Write a 5 paragraph short Cause and Effect Essay.  We have been learning about causes and effects, and different ways you can write the effects of different causes.  You need to think about what you may want to do in your life to feel successful, whatever that means to you. Success is not the same for everybody.  Think about what it means to you, and write about the three thing that you must do (causes) that will have the outcomes (effects) that you want. So cluster and/or brainstorm your ideas about what you want in life, and what you need to do to make your dream become real.  Then write a thesis statement that clearly says the 3 things you must do to be successful in life.  Then write 3 body paragraphs where you go into detail and give specifics about your ideas. Use the form of statements we learned on pages 147-149 to say what you will need to do and why. Prepare an outline with your thesis statement and notes for your body paragraphs and conclusion.

name: Your Favorite Food 5 Paragraph Descriptive Essay
intro:
You must write a 5 Paragraph Descriptive Essay about your Favorite Food.

Please follow the examples on pages 34 and 37 of the Academic Writing textbook.

You must describe in detail what your favorite food looks like, tastes like, and smells like.

Also, if there are different types of your favorite food, describe those too.

Finally, describe the context in which you eat your favorite food. 

You must type your essay directly into Moodle. You CANNOT attach any documents. 

This assignment is due one week from today on Tuesday January 26 before midnight.

You must complete this assignment before the deadline to receive full credit for this course.

name: MIDTERM EXAM (WRITING)
intro:
THIS IS TO BE DONE IN CLASS.

YOU CAN PREPARE AN OUTLINE, BUT REMEMBER, THE ONLY COMPLETE SENTENCE THAT CAN BE ON YOUR OUTLINE IS YOUR THESIS STATEMENT


Write a 4 paragraph short essay where you write a narrative (story) about an experience you had that made you learn something, or changed you in some way as a person.  It can be a life lesson, or about learning to ride a bike, or motor, or when you learned to swim.  It can be a true story, or you can make it up, but it must have an introductory paragraph, two body paragraphs, and a concluding paragraph.  Use the grammar lessons we have learned in class.  Your essay should also have some good descriptions and use specific details, not just general words.  You will be graded on form, organization, grammar and content.  Use your imagination.  You can do it!

name: Write a descriptive paragraph
intro: Write a descriptive paragraph about your favorite THING that is yours. Don't write about your family.  It could be a ring, your phone, your motorbike, a bicycle, a book, a necklace your mother gave you, anything you want.  Follow the form of the outline in the shared drive "Descriptive Paragraph Outline".  It will help you get your ideas together. Use adjectives and specific language like we have been learning about.  Don't say general things.  Have a good topic sentence, and say why it is important to you, or why you care about it.  Then give background information about it.  How did you get it? Who gave it to you? Then describe it, how it looks, how it sounds, smells, feels. Then write about how it makes you feel, or exactly why it is important to you.  Then write a concluding sentence. If you have questions, message me in telegram.  Do your own work, or you will get a 0.  You can do this!

name: Write a narrative essay
intro:
Some experiences change our lives and form our personalities. Write a narrative essay about an experience that changed you or taught you something important.

This essay will have 3 body paragraphs with an introductory paragraph and concluding paragraph.

Write your own words.

Do not copy from the internet. Do not copy work from another student.

You may use a word processing program to help write your essay then paste text in the box.

name: Brainstorming/Free writing Narrative Essay
intro:
The first step in academic writing is always brainstorming or free writing. This step is to help you find the best ideas for your essay.

You should brainstorm or free writing for 15 minutes about a life lesson that help shape for form your personality. Please see page 57 of the Academic Writing text book for instructions. 

You can use the template attached, a word document, or simply write your ideas down in your notebook. 

For this assignment, you can upload any type of document. You can upload photos, word documents, or PDF files.

You must complete this assignment by Wednesday May 12 by 11:59 p.m.

To receive full credit for this class, you must complete this assignment.

name: MIDTERM EXAM (WRITING)
intro:
DIRECTIONS: Write a short paragraph of at least 10 sentences to describe a holiday in your country. How do people celebrate the holiday?


Why is it a special day? Use specific details and examples to support your description. 


Make sure:

1.      To organize the paragraph with a topic sentence, supporting sentences, and a concluding sentence.

2.      To use specific details to describe sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and feelings in the supporting sentences.

3.      To explain why the holiday is important in the concluding sentence.

4.      To use proper grammar and punctuation, with a focus on descriptive adjectives.

intro:

Write a  3-paragraph Descriptive Essay about the place

id: \nprovides a hook, background information  and contains a strong thesis

\nstatement with your main idea.  You should have one body paragraph with a topic sentence and several strong, specific, supporting details.  You should be descriptive, and write at least one simile.  Then, your concluding paragraph should restate your main idea in a different way, and resay your main points and maybe a final thought.  Good luck, you can do it.
\ncopy from the internet. Do not copy work from another student.

name: ESSAY: Comparison-contrast essay
intro:
Choose ONE of the following topics and write a 4-5 paragraph essay.

Topics:

* Thai movies & Khmer movies - compare/contrast movie styles in Cambodia and Thailand. Some ideas: what are the themes popular in Thai movies compared to Khmer movies, what is the quality of the film (images, production, sound, etc.)

* Rural life & urban life - compare/contrast the differences in urban [city] and rural [country] life. Some ideas: compare the speed of life, cost of living, recreational activities, etc. Do NOT compare Siem Reap and Phnom Penh, but you may use Siem Reap and Phnom Penh as examples.

* Life now & life 60 years ago - compare/contrast life now (before COVID) and life in the 1960s. What has changed? What remains the same?

intro: Write a short paragraph of at least 10 sentences to

id:
\n

Describe your special possession clearly including how it looks and feels. Express your feeling about your special possession. Explain why this special possession is meaningful to you.
\norganize the paragraph with a topic sentence, supporting sentences, and a

\nuse proper grammar and punctuation with a focus on descriptive adjectives.

name: Part 2: Writing

Make sure: 

1.  To organize the paragraph with a topic sentence , supporting sentences, and a concluding sentence 

2.  To use specific details to describe sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and feelings in supporting sentences 

3.  To explains why the holiday is important in a concluding sentence. 

4.   To use proper grammar and punctuation, with a focus on descriptive adjectives.

name: FINAL EXAM (WRITING)
intro:
DIRECTIONS: Read the question below. You have 80 minutes to plan, write, and revise your paragraph. Typically, an effective response will contain a minimum of 150 words.


Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?

         "Money does not make a person happy."

Use specific reasons and examples to support your opinion.

name: IEAP 3 Final Exam Part 2: Essay
intro: I want you to write your own comparison-contrast essay.  You can pick your own topic, but I want you to pick two things (or places, people, etc.) that you can write well about.  Please show what you learned the last two units in the grammar lessons with verb tenses, conjunctions, connectors, and comparatives. Like before, you can send me an outline in telegram if you want any feedback before you write your essay.  This essay will be graded on form, unity, coherence, grammar and vocabulary.  All of you have improved, some more than others.  But now is your chance to show what you have learned.  If you have questions, feel free to message me in telegram.  Good Luck!

name: Write your own narrative essay
intro: I want you all to write your own short story (in essay form) where you tell about an experience you had that made you learn something,.  Your thesis statement should say a little about what you learned and why it is important.  You can use the "A Scary Secret" (p.61) as a model, and the outline on page 76. Remember to use specific language and try to be descriptive.  You should have an introductory paragraph, two body paragraphs, and a conclusion. You should use time adverbs to show the order things happened, and the past continuous to show things that were happening as your story develops.  Feel free to message me if you have any questions.

name: Write an outline for your Narrative Essay
intro: Please write an outline for your narrative essay you will write for the unit quiz.  Please follow the form I have uploaded in the shared drive called '.... EAW outline p.60...'  This way you can get practice making an outline and write a better essay.  You can find the file in the shared drive at the top of the class page. I want you to start planning your narrative essay that you will write for your Unit 3 quiz.  The topic of the essay is to tell a story about something that happened to you that you learned something from.  Remember to follow the form, and get specific.  Try to also describe things.  Feel free to message me if you have any questions.

name: Outline for Narrative Essay
intro:
The second step of academic writing is outlining. 

In this step you will write a hook, thesis statement, topic sentences, and a concluding sentence.

Use the Outline Template attached.

For this assignment, you can upload any file type. You can upload photos, word document, or PDF files of your outline.

You must complete this assignment by Friday May 14.

You must complete this assignment to receive full credit for this class.

name: Final EXAM: Part II (Writing)
intro: Write a paragraph about a time when someone gave you advice. What did the person tell you? How did the person’s words help you? Use specific details and examples to describe the events.

name: Unit 2: Descriptive Writing:  Write a paragraph
intro: Write a descriptive paragraph using your brainstorm and ideas from our zoom chat about your favorite food.  Remember, this is descriptive writing, so use adjectives and get specific.  No general statements!  Keep in mind that this, along with the feedback I give you will help you to write your first short essay, on the same topic.  This short essay will be graded as the first part of the Unit 2 Quiz.  Please do it as soon as possible to give me time to give you feedback, and you time to write your short essay next.  It will be assigned on Saturday the 20th, and due on Tuesday the 23.  Get to work, and good luck.

name: Mid-term EXAM-Part II (Writing)
intro: Write six sentences. Use two or

id:
\nmore words from the word bank in each sentence.


Make sure:

\n

1. Each sentence contains a subject and a verb.

name: Chapter 4 Process (How To) Paragraph: Unit 4
intro:
Write a process (How to) paragraph.

Describe the steps for choosing an important gift such as a wedding gift.

How do you decide what to buy?

Where do you go to buy it?

Your process paragraph should have at least 10 good sentences and include a topic sentence, supporting sentences, and a concluding sentence. 

Please follow the 3 steps listed on pages 100 and 101 of the text book.

name: Brainstorming Compare and Contrast
intro:
Please brainstorm about two places to compare and contrast.

Please see exercise 1 on page 84 of the Academic Writing Textbook. 

Also, you should read the compare and contrast brainstorm, outline, and essay regarding Phsar Leu Market and Makro Super Store posted in Moodle.

You must complete this brainstorming activity by Thursday June 3.

You must complete this assignment to receive full credit in this course.

name: Final Exam Part 2 The Opinion Paragraph
intro: Write your own opinion paragraph about where you think is a good place to live. You need to have a good topic sentence with your controlling idea, at least 3 reasons to support your idea (a fact, an explanation, or an experience) and a concluding sentence. You can use the outline for opinion paragraphs that I put for you in Moodle.  DO NOT COPY YOUR PARAGRAPH OR YOU WILL FAIL THE CLASS.  There is  no time to redo it.  Good luck everyone, do your best.  Try to fix your grammar before you submit it. And you need to send a text file, no pictures of handwriting or screenshots.

name: EXAM I: Part II (ESSAY)
intro:
Relatives are visiting you from far away.

Write a  5-paragraph Descriptive Essay about the place

\nstatement listing three body paragraph topics. Body paragraphs include 3

name: Using reason to support an opinion
intro: Do the Exercise 4 on page 143 in your book.  Complete the sentences with a place for #2-4.  Then write 3 sentences. One with a fact, one with an explanation, and one with an experience to support the opinion sentence.  You can do the work and your book, or on a separated piece of paper and take a picture, or however you want to submit it.  You can do this.  It will  help you to write your final paragraph late.  Remember, assignments do count for your grade.  You can do it!  Send me a message if you have any questions.

name: Outline Compare and Contrast Essay
intro:
Please use the outline template attached to outline the compare and contrast essay.

Each student must complete the outline template attached by Friday June 4.

Each student must complete the compare and contrast outline to receive full credit for this course.

You can type or hand write the outline. If you hand write the outline, simply take photos of your outline and upload those photos into Moodle.

name: Unit 1 Quiz Part 2 Writing a paragraph
intro: Write a paragraph about Cambodia.  You can say anything you want.  Write it in the form of a paragraph as shown on page 3. But I want you to have a good topic sentence with a strong controlling idea.  Then have at least a 5 supporting sentences.  Make sure each one supports the controlling idea by giving more details, examples, facts, or explanations.  Then write a concluding sentence. Make sure you use punctuation.  Try to not write run-on sentences. You will be grade on form, grammar and ideas. GOOD LUCK! You can DO IT!

name: Unit 1 Assessment 2
intro: Practice writing your own introductory paragraph.  Food is your topic.   You can write whatever you want to about food, but remember to make a strong topic sentence, with a specific controlling idea.  Get specific, not general and remember, your topic sentence should not just be a general statement.  Then write at least 4 supporting sentences, making sure they have coherence and unity.  Finish by writing a good concluding sentence.   Good luck!  You can do it.

name: Midterm Part 2 The Descriptive Paragraph
intro: Write a descriptive paragraph about your favorite place to go.  Have a GOOD topic sentence, supporting sentences, and a concluding sentence. Use adjectives to describe how the place looks, sounds, feels, smells. Use specific language to say more about the place.  I want to see, hear, smell, and feel the place from your words. You will be graded on your descriptions, use of specific language, paragraph form and grammar.  You can use the outline on page 50 to help you. You can do it!

name: Writing
intro:
Write at least 20 sentences  to describe the place where you live. What do you like or dislike about it? 

   - Use prepositional phrases to describe location.

   - Use there is and there are  with singular and plural nouns

   - Use proper grammar and punctuation, with a focus on correct use of the articles a and an with single nouns.

name: Sensory and Emotional Details
intro: In your book on pages 115, and 116, write a supporting sentence with Sensory or Emotional details for each of the sentences in exercises 4 and 5.  Page 115 is Sensory details, and Page 116 is Emotional details. Try to write in complete sentences.  You can write in your book or another journal, and take a picture and send it in. This is to help you practice for the Unit Quiz, where you will write your own Narrative paragraph. Message me in telegram if you have any questions.

name: Compare and Contrast Essay Unit 4
intro:
Please write a 5 paragraph compare and contrast essay.

In Unit 4, we are studying  compare and contrast essay.

Please follow the books examples and compare and contrast two places.

You could compare and contrast two markets, two cities, two schools or any other two places that you want.

name: Narrative Paragraph Unit Quiz
intro: Write your own narrative paragraph about a challenging situation from your life.  Tell your own story, and use at least one sensory detail and at least one emotional detail. You will be graded on form, grammar, and sentence structure. You can use the outline in the shared drive named Narrative Paragraph Outline. Remember, you will be using mostly the simple past and the past continuous when necessary and accurate. Good luck. You can do it!

name: Write your first paragraph.  Topic: Rainy Season
intro: Write a paragraph about rainy season.  The paragraph should have a good topic sentence with a strong controlling idea.  Then you should have a least 4 supporting sentences, and a concluding sentence.  The paragraph should have Unity, and Coherence. You will be graded on grammar, organization, and unity and coherence.  You can do it!  Good luck. Feel free to message me if you have any questions.

name: Mid-Term Essay
intro: Write a 5-paragraph cause-and-effect essay:

id:
\n
TOPIC: Children who play team sports have better communications skills and higher confidence


Information on cause-and-effects essay can be found in the textbook in Unit 3.

Your essay should have an introductory paragraph, 3 body paragraphs, and a concluding paragraph.

name: OUTLINE for Comparison-Contrast Essay
intro:
Using ONE (1) of the topics from page 102, make an outline (like page 100) for a comparison-contrast essay.

1. Hook

2. Background information

3. Thesis Statement

4. Topic & controlling idea for Body Paragraph #1

5. Topic & controlling idea for Body Paragraph #2

6. Topic & controlling idea for Body Paragraph #3

7. Summary & Comment

name: Exercise: Writing supporting sentences
intro:
Write two supporting sentences for each topic sentence.

1. A few years ago I had a frightening experience.

2. Maintaining a healthy body requires exercise and a balanced diet.

3. Many people find city life exciting.

4. The ability to speak more than one language is becoming more important than ever in the 21st century.

name: Final Essay
intro:
Write a 5-paragraph cause-and-effect essay on the subject: "Effects of the COVID-19 Pandemic on Siem Reap".

The essay should contain an introductory paragraph (with hook, background, and thesis statement), 3 body paragraphs, and a solid conclusion.

DUE: Saturday night, 11pm, 12 December 2020.

name: FINAL EXAM (WRITING)
intro:
DIRECTIONS: Write an opinion paragraph about the features of a place you would like to live in outside of Siem Reap. 

Consider a few of these points; entertainment, weather, employment, education, health care, culture, safety, costs, nature, transportation, housing or any other feature important to you.

name: Final EXAM (Writing)
intro:
Write about the following topic:

Teachers should be paid more when their students get high scores on tests.

Do you agree or disagree?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

name: Final Essay
intro:
Write a 5-paragraph cause-and-effect essay on the subject: "Effects of the COVID-19 Pandemic on Siem Reap".

The essay should contain an introductory paragraph (with hook, background, and thesis statement), 3 body paragraphs, and a solid conclusion.

DUE: Saturday night, 11pm, 12 December 2020.

name: Mid-term Exam - ESSAY
intro:
Write a 5-paragraph comparison-contrast essay on:
TOPIC: Traditional learning vs. e-Learning


Your paragraph should have an introductory paragraph, 3 body paragraphs, and a concluding paragraph.

For information on comparison-contrast essays, see unit 4 in the textbook.

name: Writing Sample
intro:
Write a paragraph about what an ideal short vacation would be for you.

You have 5 days vacation and enough money. What would you do? Stay at home and go out to eat in a nice restaurant? Take a small trip to Kampot?

Make sure your paragraph has a topic sentence, strong supporting sentences, and a conclusion that relates to the topic.

name: Make up EXAM (For Kheang Sokim)
intro:
Write a paragraph about this topic:

Employers like to hire people who prepare well for job interviews. Describe an effective process, the steps for preparing for a job interview. Use specific details and examples in your answer.

name: Introduction - Writing about you.
intro: Please write at least 5 sentences about you.  You can write whatever you want.  This is a chance for me to see how you write so far.  It is important I know where you have trouble so I can help you the best I can.  Good luck, and look forward to reading about you.

name: Introduction - Writing about you.
intro: Please write at least 5 sentences about you.  You can write whatever you want.  This is a chance for me to see how you write so far.  It is important I know where you have trouble so I can help you the best I can.  Good luck, and look forward to reading about you.

name: FINAL EXAM-PART I (WRITING)
EXERCISE: Attributing quotes to sources (p. 98)
intro: Use the chart at the bottom of page 98 and write each quotation properly here.

name: EXAM III ( Essey)
intro: Technology can improve lives, but it can also create new problems in society. Write an opinion essay about a controversy involving technology and how it affects individuals, families, and/or society.

name: EXAM III ( Essey)
intro: Technology can improve lives, but it can also create new problems in society. Write an opinion essay about a controversy involving technology and how it affects individuals, families, and/or society.

name: WRITING: Descriptive Essay
intro: Write a 4-5 paragraph descriptive essay.

id:
\n

Describe a place that has special significance for you.

\n

Describe where it is, what the place looks like, the people who live there, and the feelings you have about the place.

name: ESSAY WRITING: Cause-and-effect Essay
intro:
Write a 5-paragraph essay about the causes of stress in Siem Reap right now. [Please talk about the causes of stress for people in general and not just your own personal stress.]

Due by Saturday night, 10 October at 11pm. No extensions.

intro: Write a paragraph, with a good topic sentence, supporting sentences and a concluding sentence.  You can choose your own topic, but remember, be specific.  Not general statements!

- Use the correct form of Present Simple.

- Maximum 10 sentences in your paragraph

Write a 5-paragraph narrative essay about ONE of the topics on page 78 in the textbook.
